title: I have the way to finally balance Zed once and for all.
body:
Give his R teleport back an energy cost.

Say, 50 energy to use the port back ensures that he's either going in with his energy fully topped off and getting out with nothing left to do for the rest of the fight, or that he goes in and *has* to stick around for a few seconds after unloading all of his burst.

replies.body: As a Zed main, this wouldn't do anything. You will ALWAYS at least get energy back from WE so the cost is nonexistant. Late game Zed's abilities cost 125 energy without taking into account any refunds so it would be nonexistent. Just like Shen E energy refund now does nothing because you need to wait 1 second to be able to cast both Q and W

Ah yes, but that's *late game* Zed. This change is not only targeted more at early and mid-game Zed (especially when Zed's lane has just hit 6)

In the case of lategame Zed, it's still more energy than he currently uses. Since energy does take a(n extremely short) amount of time to regenerate, it's more time in a teamfight that he's doing nothing but autoattacking.

Of course, it's a number that can always be adjusted, but I put what I thought would be a good baseline for the whole game down.

At level 9 Zed's entire combo costs 145 energy, so as soon as level 9 this change becomes irrelevant. That's not counting the energy regen by hitting 2 Qs or Es, also he has 6 seconds to port back so he will regen all the energy he needs before it runs out.

A better thing to do would be just to revert him to the way he was on release, R spawns a shadow next to the target and has limited range, that way you can't chase him across the map only for him to disappear, also you need to use W as your escape which has a lower duration, that means CCing him will actually be a viable counter outside of major teamfights.

You're right. It *shouldn't* affect Zed too much.

But if it forces him to stick around where he can get cced and bursted for even a bit longer, then I think it's a change worth making.

> [{quoted}](name=haaaaaaaalp,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RscLp4T9,comment-id=000200000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-11T23:22:19.230+0000)

Zed doesn't depend on the +ad from his w for anything, he can functional very well without it and keeping it will only keep zed overpowered.

First, Zed is not overpowered.

Second, while his abilities are manaless, they are not resourceless, and if he spams them off cooldown he will not have the energy to perform his burst when he actually needs it.

Finally, Zed only has 2 (well 3 but his ult is sort of a weird thing where it's like a multiplier of his existing damage, rather than a pure damage ability on its own) damage abilities, and the bonus AD ratios on those are only "okay". If you compare his ratios to Lee Sin, Talon, or Riven, with multiple abilities in the 90-100s range, you see his ad ratio's are actually a bit less than average; the %bonus AD increase only serves to bring those ratios up to be on par with other AD caster type champions so, 125% bonus AD on his Q, and 100% bonus AD on his E, both of which are totally reasonable being AD scaling ratios, since he has only 2 direct damage abilities. This is especially true as the scaling bonus ad steroid is directly tied to his W level, which he levels *last*.

I think you're really overblowing his damage numbers.
This could break his kit just as quickly as make it. No doubt his energy costs would need at least minor tweaking across the board.

Given that Zed currently has the most forgiving energy costs and easiest energy return mechanics of all the ninjas (hell, the only energy-user who actually feels constrained by it is Shen) the point of this is to actually make energy a limit on him, instead of merely an incentive to avoid cooldown reduction like it is now.

So...no.

I wouldn't really say he has the easiest energy return mechanic (he has to hit a single ability twice on a target, as opposed to Shen walking up to some and autoattacking them for energy back), though he does feel less constrained by it, especially with how hard his abilities scale down in cost with level. Just adding an extra energy cost to his kit, however, won't necessarily solve anything, especially given they'd have to rebalance most of his costs around having that new one (energy seems so infinite because it regenerates so fast during spell cooldowns; add too many energy costs and you have to figure out how many spells you want him to be able to use in succession, which spells you want him to be able to use in succession...). I'm not saying it's a bad idea, just that it's almost definitely not a simple cure-all.

That's actually the major point of this change. Zed, especially lategame Zed, does not actually have to worry about running out of energy before he's finished his whole combo, even if he's been poking beforehand. So how do you give the enemy a chance to play against that? You give his ult an opportunity cost. He's still jamming it in and bursting down a target, but if he was incautious about his energy usage then he's stuck there and hopefully the rest of the enemy team can collapse on him and get a return kill.

It should be the other way around. Casting his ulti now costs let's say 50 energy.

Um. No.

This isn't a change to prevent Zed from diving in. It's not supposed to be a neutral change. This is a flat nerf, and it's meant to punish Zeds who don't manage their energy by preventing them from having R's easy escape.

I feel like, you're just kind of emoting because his damage *feels* really high (since he has multipliers around his ult, passive and yes, his AD steroid), but he needs to fulfill a lot of conditions to get all of that damage off in proper order - so when the stars align and Zed plays properly, his damage *becomes* really big, but it's big because it's a sum of a lot of parts, not all just straight unconditional casting power like an Annie or Talon (which is just no hoops tons of DAMAGE RIGHT NOW).
